results.title: The Find me book: self help in action
results.brief_description: The Volunteer Emergency Reserve was established in 1965 and acts as a vital backup to the Victoria Police in emergencies. In 1974, the VER was called in to assist in the search for a young boy lost in the bush. This child was not found, but to help prevent further such tragedies the “Find me book” was devised. The distinctive orange colored pages of the book can be torn out and used by the lost person to mark their way. Points on how to stay comfortable in the bush are also given.

results.title: The Final hour of Joan of Arc
results.creator_credit: Bernard Girard, James Fonda, Columbia Broadcasting System and Young America Films
results.brief_description: One of the “You are There” television series, which reconstructs the events of 29th and 30th May, 1431, at Rouen. Spurred on by the English, who wish to ensure that Joan does not revive the campaign against them, the Church authorities press the interrogation of Joan, and next day have her burnt at the stake as a “lapsed heretic”. Includes Dianna Lynn as Joan. Written for television by Milton Geiger; director of photography by Ed Fitzgerald and narrated by Walter Cronkite.

results.title: The Final game
results.brief_description: A stirring account of the championship game played by the Boston Celtics, internationally-known champions of professional basketball, against their challengers, the Cincinnati Royals. Using a variety of cinetechniques this film captures this exciting, graceful game.

results.title: The Final cut
results.creator_credit: Mike Vardy, Ken Riddington and BBC
results.brief_description: Urquhart is determined to remain in power longer than Margaret Thatcher but as that time approaches, his hold on the poltical ladder is not as firm. Tom Makepeace, the Foreign Secretary is likely to be his successor and is encouraged by his mistress to challenge the leadership. Urquhart’s past is threatening to overtake him but he and his wife are determined that his years as the Prime Minister will end in glory, not defeat. Ian Richardson is superb as Francis Urquhart in a compelling performance and this finale to the Urquhart story is both gripping and dramatic.

results.title: The Final Academy Documents 1982
results.brief_description: The second video in the ‘Final Academy Documents’ contains William S. Burroughs reading his novel and John Giorno reading his poetry to music recorded at the “Fianl Academy” evening at the Hacienda Club in Manchester in 1982.

results.title: The Final academy documents 1962/63
results.brief_description: Contains archival film footage of William S. Burroughs and Brion Gysin, filmed by the late Anthony Balch in 1962-1963. Includes “Ghosts at Number 9” and the classic film “Towers Open Fire”.

results.title: The Filth and the fury
results.creator_credit: Julien Temple, Amanda Temple, Anita Camarata, Nitrate Films and Jersey Shore
results.brief_description: This honest film is suitable for both fans of the band and social historians. The documentary traces the dramatic rise and fall of the Sex Pistols in 70s London, using a collage of interesting footage from the time of chaos and rebellion. Throughout the film Shakespeare’s “Richard III” is irreverently referred to as being emblematic of the Sex Pistols being a band created during a time ripe for rebellion and individuality. The band members are interviewed in the shadows as if to keep their current identities hidden. These members give a personal account - as a voice over - throughout the documentary, bringing to life the rare footage of the punk movement.

images.caption: The Filth and the fury (Julien Temple) still

results.title: The Films of George Melies 1861 to 1938
results.brief_description: The French pioneer Georges Melies made films from 1896 to 1913. This compilation has three parts. Part one includes “The Vanishing lady” his first trick film; “The Brahmin and the buttefly”; “Indiarubber head” and “Reproduction: coronation ceremonies. Part Two incudes: “A Trip to the moon”; “The Mysterious box” and “The Marvellous wreath”. Part Three: “The Melomaniacs”; “The Bewitched trunk”; “The Four hundred tricks of the devil” and “The Knight of the black art”.

results.title: The Film of the Royal Ballet
results.creator_credit: Paul Czinner, Royal Opera House Covent Garden and Poetic Films
results.brief_description: Starring Margot Fonteyn, the great Prima Ballerina, in the principal female roles and Michael Somes in the lead male roles, this film showcases three of ballets’ most moving performances. Three tragic tales of doomed love filmed during performances of the Corps De Ballet of the Royal Opera House. Director of Ballet is Dame Ninette De Valois. Music is performed by the Covent Garden Orchestra. The first is Piotr Tchaikovsky’s brilliant “Swan Lake, Act II” which depicts the powerful meeting of the hunter, Prince Siegfried, and the prey, a graceful swan who transforms into a beautiful girl. The second performance is of Igor Stravinsky’s “The firebird”, the story of a travelling prince who captures a fantastical firebird who bargains her way to freedom by giving him one of her magic feathers. The third performance is of Hans Werner Henze’s “Ondine”, the story of Palemon, who is torn between his love of Berta and a water-sprite, Ondine.
